    • Method Detail

      • isVoidable

        boolean isVoidable()

        Identifies whether a Recovery entity is voidable or not. An entity is voidable if it is not a an offset recovery and its TransactionStatus status is SUBMITTING or SUBMITTED.

        Returns:
        True if the Recovery and false if it is not.

      • voidRecovery

        void voidRecovery()
           throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException
        Voids a Recovery entity. This action does not require approval.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the recovery status is not either TransactionStatus.SUBMITTING or TransactionStatus.SUBMITTED.
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - if the financials version parameter is read-only.

      • isUseRecoveryReserves

        boolean isUseRecoveryReserves()
        True if the system is configured to use recovery reserves.
        Returns:
        true if the system is configured to use recovery reserves, false otherwise

      • isOffsetRecovery

        boolean isOffsetRecovery()
        If this recovery is offsetting another recovery, returns true.
        Returns:
        true if this recovery offsets another recovery.

      • getRecoveryBeingOffset

        Recovery getRecoveryBeingOffset()
        If this is an offset recovery, retrieves the recovery that is being offset. If this is not an offset recovery, returns NULL.
        Returns:
        the recovery being offset by this recovery, if any, else returns NULL.

      • getOnsetOriginalRecovery

        Recovery getOnsetOriginalRecovery()
        The original Recovery for which this transaction is an onset recovery. The original is usually Recoded or Transferred. null if this recovery is not an onset
        Returns:
        the recovery for which this recovery is an onset, if any. null if not an onset.

      • logVoid

        void logVoid()
        Logs a message about voiding this Recovery.

      • denyRecovery

        void denyRecovery()
           throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException
        Called when recovery is denied by downstream system. This action does not require approval.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the recovery status is not one of the following: TransactionStatus.TC_SUBMITTING, TransactionStatus.TC_SUBMITTED
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - is the financials version parameter is read-only

      • resubmitRecovery

        void resubmitRecovery()
               throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException
        Called when recovery is being resumbmitted. This action does not require approval.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the recovery status is not one of the following: TransactionStatus.TC_DENIED
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - is the financials version parameter is read-only

      • isResubmittable

        boolean isResubmittable()
        True if this recovery is resubmittable. Specifically, its status is one of the following:
        • TransactionStatus.TC_DENIED
        and it is not an offset recovery.
        Returns:
        true if this recovery is resubmittable, false otherwise

      • deleteRecovery

        void deleteRecovery()
             throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException
        Called when recovery is being deleted. This action does not require approval.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the recovery status is not one of the following: TransactionStatus.TC_DENIED
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - is the financials version parameter is read-only

        Parameters:

      • createOnsetRecovery

        Recovery createOnsetRecovery()
        Creates an onset recovery for recode or transfer. The onset has matching details as its origin, with the following exceptions: The onset is created in a new RecoverySet. The onset initially has a null comment. The onset initially has a status of DRAFT. The onset initially has a lifecyclestate of NEW. An offset recovery in the negative amount of the origin is also created. The onset and offset recoveries are linked to the origin recovery (via TransactionOffset and TransactionOnset). This method is intended to be used in conjunction with recode() or transfer(). If this method is called but recode() or transfer() is not, a bundle commit will fail because onset recoveries must have a lifecyclestate of COMMITTED before being committed, and only recode() or transfer() will transition it to that state.
        Returns:
        the newly created onset recovery
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this recovery is not transferrable

      • recode

        void recode()
        Recodes this recovery (the origin) to its onset recovery. The onset should have first been created by calling createOnsetRecovery(). The origin must have a status of SUBMITTING or SUBMITTED. The onset cannot be null and must be new, and it must be in NEW lifecyclestate. The onset's transaction amount must match the origin's transaction amount. If any of these requirements are not satisfied, an IllegalStateException is thrown. The onset must differ from the origin in at least one of the following fields: exposure, cost type, cost category, or one of its line item's line categories. If none of these fields are changed from the origin, a UserDisplayableException is thrown. Upon transfer, the onset's reserve line is correctly set (if not already done so) based on the exposure, cost type, and cost category. The onset is transitioned to COMMITTED lifecyclestate. The onset's RecoverySet's claim is set to the onset's claim. The origin's status is set to PENDINGRECODE. If recovery reserves are enabled, any zeroing offset on the original recovery is undone, and a zeroing offset is created on the onset recovery (if necessary).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this recovery's onset is not a valid recovery to be transferred to
        com.guidewire.pl.web.controller.UserDisplayableException - if this recovery's onset does not have a changed exposure/cost type/cost category/line category

      • transfer

        void transfer()
        Transfers this recovery (the origin) to its onset recovery. The onset should have first been created by calling createOnsetRecovery(). The origin must have a status of SUBMITTING or SUBMITTED. The onset cannot be null and must be new, and it must be in NEW lifecyclestate. The onset's transaction amount must match the origin's transaction amount. If any of these requirements are not satisfied, an IllegalStateException is thrown. The onset must differ from the origin in at least one of the following fields: exposure, cost type, cost category, or one of its line item's line categories. The onset's claim must differ from the origin's claim. If any of these requirements are not satisfied, a UserDisplayableException is thrown. Upon transfer, the onset's reserve line is correctly set (if not already done so) based on the exposure, cost type, and cost category. The onset is transitioned to COMMITTED lifecyclestate. The onset's RecoverySet's claim is set to the onset's claim. The origin's status is set to PENDINGTRANSFER. If recovery reserves are enabled, any zeroing offset on the original recovery is undone, and a zeroing offset is created on the onset recovery (if necessary).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this recovery's onset is not a valid recovery to be transferred to
        com.guidewire.pl.web.controller.UserDisplayableException - if this recovery's onset does not have a changed exposure/cost type/cost category/line category, or if the onset's claim has not changed

      • isRecodeable

        boolean isRecodeable()
        Returns true iff all the following conditions for this recovery hold: This recovery is not new. This recovery has neither an onset nor an offset recovery. This recovery is not an offset for another recovery. This recovery has a status of SUBMITTING or SUBMITTED.
        Returns:
        true if this recovery can be recoded, false otherwise

      • isTransferable

        boolean isTransferable()
        Returns true iff all the following conditions for this recovery hold: This recovery is not new. This recovery has neither an onset nor an offset recovery. This recovery is not an offset for another recovery. This recovery has a status of SUBMITTING or SUBMITTED.
        Returns:
        true if this recovery can be transferable, false otherwise

      • acknowledgeVoid

        void acknowledgeVoid()
        Acknowledges a message that that this recovery was voided. Updates its status to VOIDED.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this recovery is not in PENDINGVOID status

      • acknowledgeRecode

        void acknowledgeRecode()
        Acknowledges a message that this recovery was recoded. Updates its status to RECODED.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this recovery is not in PENDINGRECODE status

      • acknowledgeTransfer

        void acknowledgeTransfer()
        Acknowledges a message that this recovery was transferred. Updates its status to TRANSFERRED.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this recovery is not in PENDINGTRANSFER status

      • getCoding

        RecoveryCoding getCoding()
